C2 [ S ] a situation that is difficult to understand: Scientists have been trying to solve this puzzle for years. The situation remains a puzzle to all of us.
A2 [ C ] a game or toy in which you have to fit separate pieces together: The building blocks are like the pieces of a puzzle. a jigsaw puzzle
Dorling Kindersley/GettyImages
a problem or question that you have to answer by using your skill or knowledge: a crossword puzzle a puzzle book
More examplesFewer examplesShe had a complex personality that was a real puzzle to me.This puzzle has astronomers scratching their heads.Planning the camera shots can be like putting together a puzzle.Why don't you sit down and draw or do a puzzle?I spent hours reasoning out the solution to the puzzle.

C1 [ T ] to cause someone to feel confused and slightly worried because they cannot understand something: The findings of the survey puzzle me - they're not at all what I would have expected. [ + question word ] It puzzles me why she said that. Synonym
flummox informal
[ I + adv/prep ] to try to solve a problem or understand a situation by thinking carefully about it: Management are still puzzling about how the accident could have happened. Scientists are puzzling over the results of the research.
More examplesFewer examplesThe events of that night have been puzzling me for a long time.Experts were puzzled by the reports.What puzzles me is why he should have left without telling me.The games have cunning solutions, designed to keep you puzzling for just long enough to be satisfying.He had been puzzling for days about how to get into the files.
